text: Donald Morris "Don" Crothers (January 28, 1937 - March 16, 2014) was an American academic. He also a professor of chemistry at Yale University. He was best known for his work on nucleic acid structure and function. He was born in Fatehgarh, British India (now India). Crothers died from cancer on March 16, 2014 at the Smilow Cancer Hospital in New Haven, Connecticut. He was 77 years old. He was outlived by his wife and two daughters. ==References== ==Other websites== * Donald Crothers at the Yale Department of Chemistry Category:1937 births Category:2014 deaths Category:American chemists Category:Scientists from New Haven, Connecticut Category:Yale University faculty
